snippet: John L. Sampson, who is accused of stealing funds from the sale of foreclosed homes to finance a race for district attorney, sought help in arranging to “take out” witnesses against him, prosecutors said.
abstract: Prosecutors say that New York State Sen John L Sampson, accused of stealing funds from the sale of foreclosed homes to finance a race for district attorney; Sampson surrenders to federal agents and is arraigned in Federal District Court in Brooklyn on charges that include embezzlement, obstruction of justice and making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: John L. Sampson, who is accused of stealing funds from the sale of foreclosed homes to finance a race for district attorney, sought help in arranging to “take out” witnesses against him, prosecutors said.

headline.seo: John Sampson Faces Charges After Corruption Inquiry
headline.main: Senator in Corruption Case Spoke of Silencing Witnesses, Prosecutors Say
headline.print_headline: Senator in Corruption Case Spoke Of Silencing Witnesses, Prosecutors Say
